result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Malcom Bernard Johnson-Hayes

records.addlTxt:
Pre-trial conference on November 15, 2022 at 10:35 am.
Final pre-trial on January 4, 2023 at 03:30 pm.
Jury status hearing on February 3, 2023 at 09:15 am.
Jury Trial on February 21, 2023 at 09:00 am.

No contact with victim(s): R.M.C.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores or Beer Tents.   Absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed.

Clerk: Amanda.
Case called at 2:19 pm.
State appears by ADA Cody Marschall. Defendant appears from MCJ w/ Attorney Jack Mathie.
Date and Time set for IA; VRCW. 

Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction. 
Court questions deft re: complaint and rights.
Advised Right of Counsel. 

Prelim Time Limits Waived. 

PLEA:  NOT GUILTY.

COURT ORDERS: $500 sig bond - CONDITIONS: 
- No contact with victim(s): R.M.C. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
- No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores, or Beer Tents. 
- Absolute sobriety from, and no possession of alcohol. 
- Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release.  Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 1 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.
